Job Title: Early Career Hydrogeologists - Field work and Numerical Modelling
Job Descriptions:
Field expeditions across Australia
Use the science of hydrogeology to unlock information on underground water systems
Be mentored by the largest team of groundwater specialists on the east coast of Australia

At AGE Consultants, it’s our people who are shaping our future, so let’s talk about you first.
Are you the type of geoscientist who enjoys collaborating with like-minded team mates, being out in the field collecting geological and hydrogeological data, and developing robust conceptual and numerical models of complex groundwater systems? Are you yearning to work with expert senior and principal hydrogeologists and numerical modellers to deliver practical solutions to environmental challenges? Are you keen to carve out a pathway in hydrogeology? Manage water security projects that will shape Australia’s future? More career satisfaction and mentorship? More exposure to numerical modelling? A specialisation in groundwater? If the answer is yes, please read on because at AGE, we are seeking a full-time, graduates and/or early career hydrogeologists, based in our Brisbane office.
About Us
At Australasian Groundwater and Environmental Consultants Pty Ltd (AGE), we empower informed water decisions for industry, government, and communities. Established in 1997, we are wholly employee owned and operated. We proudly employ the largest team of groundwater specialists on the East Coast of Australia with 36 full-time professional hydrogeologists across our Brisbane, Newcastle, Townsville and Perth offices. We contribute to solving the world’s greatest problems in a changing global climate, by supporting the advancement and sustainability of business, communities, and our environment. With a strong reputation for high quality work, we are the go-to specialists for groundwater consulting for a changing world.
We share information openly and deliberately. We teach our modelling techniques to everyone in our team who is interested in this area. We are early adopters of new technology. Our 10-year strategic plan furthers our sustainable and robust business model and rewards everyone in our team. AGE is revolutionising.
The Roles
We have multiple pathways available for early career hydrogeologists joining our team, whether you have a passion for physical hydrogeology or a desk-based numerical modelling interest (or both!).
Supported by a team that produces high quality results, in an environment of supportive teamwork and innovation, you will assess the impacts of resource projects on groundwater systems; develop groundwater supplies for towns, villages, mines, irrigation, stock, and domestic purposes; manage dewatering and groundwater control needs around mines and deep excavations, and assess groundwater to assist in the development, management, and closure of landfills.
The field work includes FIFO and DIDO to various mining and agricultural sites, you will operate a manual 4WD vehicle; install monitoring bore/VWP installations; conduct field tests (slug tests, packer tests, and pumping tests); conduct routine collection of water sample data; download information from data loggers; design bores; analyse data; report on results; and perform routine maintenance (light duties) on the monitoring network as required.
We have developed a numerical modelling methodology that we are keen to teach all of our early career hydrogeologists in conjunction with field based studies, who will become multi-skilled groundwater specialist consultants.
Travel is required for up to 2 weeks at a time in various remote locations throughout Queensland and rural Australia.
To be successful in this role, you will have a degree in geology, environmental science or environmental engineering and ideally post graduate qualifications or courses completed that demonstrate your intention to pursue a long term hydrogeology career. You will also require-
Physical fitness and a willingness to travel for up to 2 weeks in remote Australia.
A manual drivers licence, with 4WD experience preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills
A commitment to safety
A curiosity for numerical modelling (for those interested in developing these skills)
The Opportunities
Our projects are fulfilling and challenging. We have an in-house professional development program to support you to advance your career in the direction you want to take.
You will join a team of experts including readily accessible principal consultants who have each worked in the groundwater industry for more than 20 years.
After experiencing consistent growth over many years, we have a very healthy pipeline of groundwater projects and this role is an integral part of our current and future plans. You will also have the opportunity to explore various renewable energy resources.
These are full-time stable roles with sensible work hours and a cohesive, family friendly team. We offer a long-term career pathway, competitive salary, team bonuses, time in lieu (TIL). an employee assistance program, professional memberships, and various social activities throughout the year.
Interstate applications are welcome and relocation support will be provided.
We have these new roles available in our Brisbane office as well as opportunities available in our Townsville, Newcastle and Perth offices as we continue to grow, mentor, and develop our expert team, so please get in touch with us to hear more.
How to Apply
To apply please submit your CV and cover letter via the relevant links to our Careers and Talent Consultant, Susan Leon. All applications will receive a response within 10 working days.
We thank recruitment companies for their interest however we do not wish to be contacted by agencies in regard to this role.

Are you looking to join the Navy sooner and fast-track your application? You can accelerate your career and start training in the next 3-6 months by applying for a priority role.
Whether you have recently finished school, currently studying, already in the workforce or you have no experience at all, we’re hiring. You’ll be paid from day one to gain all the skills needed with extensive on-the-job training. You may also be able to use your existing qualifications and be eligible for recognition of prior learning.
You’ll enjoy a competitive salary package, career stability, opportunities for continuous progression, and an adventurous lifestyle – all while making a difference to Australia.
Browse full-time priority roles below:
· Electronics Technician
Maintain, diagnose and repair state of the art technology and military hardware, onboard ships or submarines and ashore. You could be working with radars, sonars, satellite equipment, navigation aids, weapons systems, torpedo launchers and more.
· Marine Technician
Operate, monitor and maintain engineering systems and machinery to ensure equipment and technical systems onboard ships or submarines run at optimum capacity.
· Communications & Networks Operator
Be responsible for making sure communications and information is sent and received securely. Your duties include operating satellites, radios, IT and network systems, flashing lights (Morse code), flag signals and more.
· Weapons & Sensors Operator
Specialise in collecting and analysing sensor information and using combat data systems to make recommendations that inform tactical decisions and avoid potential threads.
Submariner:
There is also the option to specialise in some of these roles as a Submariner and be a part of the most exclusive and stable workforce in Australia. You will have a direct effect on Navy missions and operations at sea.
Benefits:
- Free medical and dental
- Competitive salary package
- Incremental salary increases as you progress through training and ranks
- 16.4% superannuation
- Job security
- Career progression and development
- Good work/life balance
- Travel opportunities
- Excellent social and fitness facilities
- Subsidised housing
- Balance of shore and sea postings
- Great chef made meals at sea
- Variety of allowances
Salary:
Upon completion of your initial military and employment training, you’ll enjoy a salary package starting from $75,451 for surface fleet and $88,437 for submariners.
Apply Now:
For these roles, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 with passes in English and Maths. Some positions may also require passes in Science.
Visit the link below for the full position descriptions:
https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/priority-roles
The Australian Defence Force is an equal opportunity employer. This advertisement is to ensure women are aware of the rewarding and fulfilling careers available in the Navy, Army and Air Force. Females are encouraged to apply, however all roles are open for Australian men and women to apply.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $75,000.00 – $90,000.00 per year
Licence/Certification:
Australian Citizenship? You must be an Australian Citizen (Required)

About us:
At M3DICINE, our mission is to create beautiful and intelligent medical devices that capture powerful clinical data and empower health professionals and patients to understand health better. Our first product is Stethee Pro, the world’s first AI enabled stethoscope system.
Stethee Pro is a tool for the passionate. For a new era of medicine. For those who think beyond tradition and outside the box. Those with no regard for the status quo. Who understand that great tools should create new experiences and opportunities at any moment, enabling, empowering, increasing our efficiency and pushing humanity forward. Every great tool leads to a new world of discovery.

Accountability:
The iOS Developer is accountable for developing the iOS interface to enable M3DICINE’s vision of seamless, elegant and easy to use tools which will assist healthcare professionals to capture and record vital signs, and to share data supporting fast, informed clinical decision making.

Role
The iOS Developer provides specialist application design skills allowing healthcare professionals and practitioners to operate Stethee Pro through their mobile device and ensuring outstanding customer experience. The iOS Developer will be joining a small cross-disciplinary team of developers including existing iOS and Android developers.

Responsibilities
Day to day responsibilities include:
Designing and developing advanced applications for the Apple iOS platform
Ongoing testing for robustness and reliability
Bug fixing and improving application performance
Ensure application stability through ongoing optimization and development
Liaise with leadership to support development of requested features in line with product roadmap and design guidelines
Follow M3DICINE’s Standard Operating Procedures and undertake ongoing thorough detailed testing processes in line with Stethee’s 6-week cycle guidelines
Follow best practice development principles to ensure code is easy to amend
Work closely with other mobile developers to ensure uniformity of approach
Develop and maintain test documentation to meet quality and regulatory requirements
Work with UI / UX to ensure consistent best practice user experience
Job Qualifications

Technical skills required:
Demonstrated experience with / Knowledge of
iOS SDK
Google Firebase
Cocoapods / Dependency management

Desirable skills / experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or related field
3 years + hands-on software development experience designing, writing, debugging and testing using Swift as a primary language
Understanding of audio file representation and manipulation
Experience working through application upgrades
Experience working with software design patterns, specifically VIPER architecture
Experience with / exposure to highly regulated industry (medical device / aviation etc.)
Strong attention to detail
Clear concise communication skills and strong written documentation
Able to learn quickly and pick up medical terminology
Ability to adapt to M3dicine’s quality and regulatory requirements
Have test driven development (TDD) experience and code review practice with peers
Comfortable to work with M3dicine’s Software development lifecycle along with QA and regulatory function as part of a multidisciplinary team
Team player actively engaging with the team to ensure uniformity across the software
Up to date with new, evolving, and emerging technologies
Passion for technology with an enthusiasm to play around with new tools and concepts

Join a dynamic team of innovative researchers
Attractive salary packaging & superannuation options
Generous start-up package available for exceptional candidates
About QIMR Berghofer:
QIMR Berghofer is a world-leading translational medical research institute focused on improving health by developing new diagnostics, better treatments and prevention strategies, specifically in the areas of Cancer, Infection and Inflammation, Mental Health and Neuroscience, and Population Health. Based in Herston, Brisbane and working in close collaboration with clinicians and other research institutes, QIMR Berghofer is home to more than 600 scientists, students and non-research staff.
Population Health Program
The Population Health Program includes 9 research groups working in a diverse range of areas from epidemiology, molecular epidemiology, supportive care and health economics to mosquito control. We are seeking research leaders conducting high-quality population health research to expand the Program. Successful applicants will be expected to lead their own research projects as well as contributing to the Program through collaboration and committee involvement.
What are we looking for?
We are currently seeking to employ outstanding independent (mid-career to senior) researcher/s (Faculty) with a track record of success in publications and attracting externally competitive grant funding. We invite applications from all areas of Population Health but are particularly interested in hearing from experts in the following research areas:
Implementation science
Modelling or big data
Please refer to the Position Description via the QIMR Berghofer Careers Page for a detailed outline of the role and responsibilities.
What do we offer?
Generous salary guarantees at all career stages
Critical mass of outstanding researchers
Shared campus with clinicians (Royal Brisbane & Women’s Hospital) and proximity to two major universities
State of the art research facilities including PC3 viral and insectary facilities, a large animal house and an advanced imaging centre
Access to the newly developed ‘Herston Imaging Research Facility’ (HIRF) including three key instruments: PRISMA 3T MRI, fully integrated PET-MRI, and PET-CT
Extensive scientific support services, including high performance computing capability
Translational research potential including onsite TGA licensed GMP Cellular Therapy facility
Personalised research support (e.g. Grants Administration, IT, Research Ethics and Clinical Trials)
In-house Business Development & Commercialisation expertise
Flexible Work Arrangements and generous leave provisions
Highly attractive salary packaging options
Excellent lifestyle, great location
For further information: Please contact Penny Webb, Program Director, Population Health via email penny.webb@qimrberghofer.edu.au
Closing Date: 15 January 2023
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.

Remuneration: An attractive package will be negotiated with the successful candidate.
To apply for this opportunity: use the APPLY button, and submit a CV/Resume and cover letter.

We are reviewing applications as they are received. If you think you’re the right person for this role, we’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.
Please refer to the Position Descriptions to identify the role that best matches your skills and experience.

Requisition ID: 263914
Relocation Authorized: National - Camp
Requisition Posting End Date: 12/19/2022
Work Location: Brisbane, QLD

Project Summary
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.

ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (www.riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia (www.energyres.com.au)

Position Summary
As our Project ESH (Environment Safety and Health) Advisor you will be responsible for providing ESH advice and facilitating, promoting and coordinating activities related to ensuring the health and safety of all project participants is maintained for the duration of the ERA Ranger Rehabilitation Project.

You will champion ESH on site and continuously contribute to a positive safety culture - leading by example, coaching personnel and providing timely advice and support as required for the entire project workforce.

This role will be based on site at the Ranger Mine jobsite offices where you will be assigned on a fly in/fly out roster (2 weeks on, 1 week off) flying to and from Darwin - with a drive to the Jabiru work site - where camp accommodation is provided.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to)
Provide technical support for site ESH assessments and project risk assessments including - Level 2 Risk Assessments, Job Hazards Analysis (JHA), review scopes of work for site ESH requirements
Contribute to readiness with timely notifications and actively participating in project 30/60/90-day planning
Contribute & coach improvement of HSE processes and procedures
Support the implementation of the Contractor HSE plan and ensure alignment in accordance with established polices, systems, processes, procedures and methods and regulations.
Participate in meetings with customers, project team members, and contractors/subcontractors to advise of project-specific mitigation plan, training program, and technical reports
Stop work in dangerous situations or conditions having imminent adverse ESH impact (i.e. person, plant & or equipment)
Assist in data collection and interpretation on project accident investigations; documents factors contributing to an incident and prepares required reports
Support inspection tours, audits of the project/facility for compliance with project ES&H requirements
Conduct fatigue assessments for the project workforce
Develop cross-training for personnel in professional or discipline-specific skills, techniques, and procedures
Support timely intervention of medical/first aid treatment and ensure contractors have effective stay at work programs for injured workers including alternate work duties.
Contribute to the project ESH orientation and training of project manual/non-manual personnel
Ensure contractor compliance in the implementation of environmental compliance inspections conducted to monitor compliance with environmental requirements including daily inspections and waste forecast and waste disposal
Validate effectiveness of COVID19 controls in work areas
Interpret applicable HSE standards and supervises implementation into work design and delivery
Complete timely report of contractor HSE performance as per project reporting requirements
Execute other HSE duties as assigned by supervisor, Site Manager, Project HSE Manager, or designated GBU ES&H management.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
Formal qualifications in environmental and/or safety engineering, process safety, health or related discipline.
Demonstrated experience in construction or mining in a safety role with some experience in supervising small teams.
Working and applied knowledge of HSE sciences/engineering systems, principles, and methodologies.
Knowledge of and experience working within an Australian legislation context (e.g. interpreting and providing advice based on relevant OHS Acts & Regulations).
Knowledge of permitting processes and responsibilities, Industry standards for HSE compliance, and best management practices for minimising HSE impacts during project execution.
Knowledge of engineering and construction systems, methods and work processes, construction planning, estimating, procedures, and execution.
Exposure to project closure or rehabilitation projects preferred.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.
#LI-RH1

Shaping tomorrow together
Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.
www.bechtel.com
Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.

NOJA Power Switchgear manufactures and supplies globally a range of microprocessor based, intelligent medium voltage switchgear providing; control, measurement and communication capabilities.
We are seeking an Embedded Software Engineer with Scada experience to join our development team. The successful applicant will enjoy being part of an organization taking Australian technology to the world.
Experience: You will have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in developing C and C++ software for embedded systems. Your strengths and experience will be in the areas of:
Development of Linux applications on 32 bit embedded systems
Eclipse, GNU Tools
Good exposure to the IP networking area (e.g. TCP/IP, sockets, network APIs)
Working with Jira, Git and Jenkins
Development over the entire SDLC
Contributing to the requirements gathering and design of solutions
Working with and integrating SCADA protocols into embedded systems
Previous exposure to the following would be highly regarded:
Development encapsulating Cyber security, including encryption and certificates.
Qualifications: You will have a degree in computer science, electrical engineering or related.
Responsibility: You will have the maturity, focus and intensity to manage your priorities and projects, while providing a reasonable degree of transparency and progress to the R&D Software Manager.
Personal Attributes: You will have a passion for using embedded technology, communications technology and data analytics to disrupt an existing market and deliver customer benefits. Be able to understand the customer's business and provide solutions that address their challenges (both current and future) and have a broader vision, be a self-starter, and take the initiative in development.
Only Brisbane applicants will be considered as there is a need for this position to be filled immediately.
Applications should be addressed to:

Murarrie Qld 4172

Job Title: Data Practitioner Lead - 18 month contract + extensions
Job Descriptions:
10 year transformation program
Competitive hourly rate
About Our Client
One of Queensland's largest employers is embarking on a large scale data transformation project, that will help to shape the future of how data is presented and used within the organisation.

Job Description
Working collaboratively with 12 teams of data practitioners across the organisation, the Data Practitioner Lead will share expertise about the newly deployed Information Insights Platform, as well as design & development methodology and data & analytics best practices. This will including internal communications, the organisation of events, creation of training and communication material, newsletter preparation and the design of collateral.

The position supports the successful delivery of reports, data and business intelligence content to users, and is critical to the business unit's key deliverable, which is to provide a data and analytics service for the organisation. You will be supported by the Insights Data Engineering, Data Science, and Production Support teams.

While there are no ongoing direct reports to this position, during times where significant training programs need to be rolled out, trainers will be engaged for delivery and they will report into this position.
The Successful Applicant
This role would best suit a technology (data) evangelist, with experience in creating a distributed community of data professionals, and drive them towards a common goal.

Key skills and experience required include:
Experience delivering Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Solutions at scale in a large enterprise environment.
Experience working in change management, communications, and/or training capacities.
Strong knowledge of SQL, T-SQL, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Power BI.
Experience in working with large, complex Data Warehouses and Dimensional Modelling

While a data engineering background would be beneficial, please note this role would NOT suit a pure Data Engineer who does not have the necessary leadership, engagement, and change management experience.


What's on Offer
18 month contract + extensions - this is a decade long transformation, and is a critical role throughout the duration of the program.
Collaborative, engaged team of professionals - this role will work closely with 12 teams of data professionals covering a variety of capabilities including BI, DW, AI, Open Data, and IoT. All teams work closely to achieve their respective goals, and are led by experienced leaders and managers in each field.
Newly deployed data platform - the business has recently deployed a significantly overhauled data platform in the cloud (Azure) and is continuously ensuring that the latest technologies are employed in order to achieve desired improvements in the delivery of data and analytics solutions across the organisation.
Hybrid work model - typically the teams work 2-3 days per week in the office, with the rest of the week working from home. Start and finish times in the day are also fully flexible to support any requirements you may have.
Competitive hourly rate - negotiable with experience, this is a 36.25 hour week, and this is a well funded project with a track record of offering excellent rates in line with the Australian market.

BE THE DIFFERENCE

At AIA we don’t simply believe in being ‘the best’. We believe in better – because there’s no limit to how far ‘better’ can take us. Everything we do is driven by our purpose to make a difference by helping people embrace Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. And every one of our people has an important part role to play. If you want to make a difference by helping shape a healthier, better-protected Australia, read on.
The Opportunity
Join the AIA Customer Care Representative Team where your focus will be to field calls and email queries and provide information and support on AIA Products
With a true focus on providing the best customer service possible you will be supporting existing as well as new members with a high level of service.
To do this successfully you will:
Handle inbound and tactical outbound enquires
Provide advice and effective explanations of AIA Insurance products and AIA Vitality
Ensure accurate amendments to membership details
Deliver exceptional customer service outcomes
Partner with a variety of internal and external stakeholders across AIA
Successful applications will demonstrate:
Proven experience working in call centre, customer service or member focused environment
Previous insurance background – desirable but not essential
Demonstrated ability to work with complex systems – desirable but not essential
Keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written & verbal
Ability to problem solve and a solutions focused approach
Why choose AIA:
At AIA, we’ve made a promise to help people live healthier, longer, better lives. And it starts with our own people.
Access our training and development to build on your current skills
Career development through internal mobility opportunities
Work for a business helping millions of Australian’s and make a difference to someone’s life everyday
Access additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself
Enjoy wonderful Health and Wellbeing initiatives that support you
Work with supportive and inclusive managers
Flexible working arrangements
At AIA Australia, we’re proud to help guide, support and protect the wellbeing of over 3.5 million Australians. Through life and health insurance, financial wellbeing and our total wellbeing ecosystem that includes AIA Vitality – the world’s leading science-backed wellbeing programme – we’ve started a movement to
make Australia the healthiest, best protected nation in the world.
As part of the AIA Group - the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group with a presence in 18 markets in Asia-Pacific – it is our ambition to engage one billion people to live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by 2030. Lots of companies like to say they’re different. What makes us truly different at AIA, is the difference we make in people’s lives.
AIA is different. Are you?

ROLE SUMMARY
The National Parks Association of Queensland Inc. (NPAQ) advocates for the protection, expansion and effective management of the protected areas in Queensland; offers a bushwalking and outdoor recreation activities program; and provides opportunities to participate in community conservation and citizen science projects.
NPAQ supports the development and application of scientific and professional knowledge in advancing national parks and nature conservation in Queensland.
Working closely with the NPAQ Council and its various committees, staff and volunteers, your role is to contribute to the achievement of NPAQ’s mission, the building of a sustainable future for NPAQ, and strengthening the Association’s funding base and public profile.
The role requires experience and/or specific capability in the following areas:
Fundraising
Marketing/promotions
Member/supporter attraction and retention
Grant writing
Research and data insights
Stakeholder relations
Communications and engagement
Accountabilities
The duties of the role will encompass, but not be limited to, those outlined below.
Key Accountabilities
Reviewing and critically assessing fundraising activities undertaken by NPAQ and other similar organisations, including (but not limited to):
Membership drives
Public appeals
Regular giving – members and supporters
Major donations
Bequests
Grants
Corporate sponsorship
Assisting with the development of a three-year fundraising strategy and action plan (2023-25), to enhance income outcomes for NPAQ.
Planning and implementing fundraising activities in line with the approved fundraising strategy and action plan.
Regularly monitoring, evaluating and reporting on the outcomes of fundraising activities.
Conceiving new and innovative fundraising opportunities, with supporting evidence.
Scoping out and applying for relevant grants to supplement NPAQ’s other fundraising outcomes.
Contributing content to key NPAQ Communications, including Neck of the Woods (monthly), Protected (four times per annum), NPAQ’s Annual Report and NPAQ’s website and social media channels.
Supplying relevant fundraising data and intelligence to inform marketing and promotional campaigns.
Sharing insights and tactics to help retain members, supporters and subscribers.
Other Accountabilities
Develop partnerships with key stakeholders and the broader fundraising community.
Assist in driving advocacy and public engagement to ensure organisational growth and relevance.
Participate in strategic and operational planning, team building and performance development.
Relationships
The role reports directly to the NPAQ Chief Executive Officer.
The role works closely with:
NPAQ Chief Executive Officer
NPAQ Operations Manager
NPAQ Conservation Manager
NPAQ Marketing and Engagement Committee
Other key relationships are:
NPAQ Council/Executive
NPAQ contractors and consultants
NPAQ members, financial supporters and online supporters
NPAQ sponsors, donors and grant-giving bodies
Other not-for-profit organisations involved in fundraising.
Special Conditions
Will be required to abide by the NPAQ Code of Conduct.
Some weekend and out of hours work may be required.
Inter and intra state travel as required.
A current driver’s licence is essential.
Selection Criteria
Essential:
Experience in the development and implementation of fundraising strategies, plans and campaigns to support ongoing financial sustainability and organisational growth.
Demonstrated success in donor stewardship strategies to engage, retain and grow a strong community of supporters and increase income.
Proven experience in applying for and securing grant funding.
Demonstrated knowledge of data-driven market insights, audience segmentation and user targeting.
Strong people skills and a flexible approach when working in a team.
Desirable:
A passion for protecting the environment.
At least three-years’ experience in not-for-profit fundraising working across multiple fundraising streams.
Excellent writing skills and experience in writing for appeals, digital communications, social media and websites.
Appropriate tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Fundraising or Marketing or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and education/training.
This role description serves to illustrate the scope and responsibilities of the role and is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties. You will be expected to perform other job-related tasks requested by the Chief Executive Officer, and as necessitated by the development of this role and the development of NPAQ.
How to Apply:
To apply for this role, please submit a cover letter (x1 page) explaining why you are interested in the role. Please include a response to how you meet the selection criteria, together with your Resume (x4 pages maximum).

At AGE, it is our people who are shaping our future, so let’s talk about you first.
Are you the type of hydrogeologist who enjoys collaborating with likeminded colleagues, developing robust conceptual models of complex groundwater systems and teaming up with expert numerical modellers to deliver practical solutions for clients? Are you an established senior project hydrogeologist, with the desire to work in a team where groundwater is the prime focus? Do you long to work with a highly experienced, expert group of groundwater consultants? If the answer is yes, please read on.
About Us
At Australasian Groundwater and Environmental Consultants Pty Ltd (AGE), we empower informed water decisions for industry, government, and communities. Having recently celebrated 25 years in groundwater consultancy, we proudly employ the largest team of groundwater specialists in Australia with over 30 full-time professionals across our Brisbane, Perth, Newcastle, and Townsville offices. We are wholly employee owned and operated, consulting to mining and CSG sectors, renewable energy projects in Australia and across the world.
We share information openly and deliberately. We are early adopters. Our outstanding team is a culturally diverse group of people from all corners of the globe, bringing passion and expertise to the team.
We place great importance on the development of robust hydrogeological conceptual models. This is a collective experience, where we extract information, explore curiosities, collaborate with colleagues, and allow deep thinking. We invest time in the conceptualisation process, to develop trusted, powerful insights, and convey complex information in a simple, understandable language to broad audiences. This time invested early in our projects, builds understanding and allows us to cooperate with clients, to solve real problems and achieve real outcomes. Our robust conceptual models provide the foundation to allow development of industry leading numerical models, put together by a team of expert numerical modellers who specialise in the use of the MODFLOW code, and its many variants. AGE’s groundwater models are custom-made, using in-house code to build, run and process simulations.
The Role
AGE is seeking a Senior Project Consultant to join our diverse team, predominantly supporting our Townsville office. Managing groundwater projects across Queensland, this role is field focused, delivering on of a variety of challenging endeavours. The hydrogeological field programs include: hydrogeochemical groundwater sampling, level logger installation and monitoring, falling head tests, drill hole logging and testing, installing monitoring bores and vibrating wire piezometers, packer testing, and pumping tests. Follow up desktop work collating data, analysing results and compiling factual report will also be required. This role will analyse and assess the impacts from resource or industrial projects on groundwater systems; develop or test groundwater supplies; determine dewatering and groundwater control needs around mines and deep excavations; and assess groundwater issues to assist in the development, management, and closure of projects with the potential to contaminate or impact groundwater.
This is a full time, long term role with sensible work hours and a cohesive, family-friendly team.
You
You will be an established Hydrogeologist, Geochemist, Hydrologist or Environmental Scientist, who enjoys a combination of field work and desktop studies.
With a minimum of 2-5 years of solid experience, independently managing field investigations throughout Australia, you will be proficient in: -
· packer testing
· pumping tests
· drill hole logging and testing
· installing monitoring bores and VWPs
· managing baseline monitoring programs including water quality sampling and level logger installation.
Applicants will require a minimum of an honours degree in earth science, geoscience, environmental science, geology or engineering, with a preference for master’s qualifications or higher in hydrogeology or geochemistry.
Your confidence in managing complex field studies and an interest in the challenges of Queensland’s ancient landscape will be complemented by refined interpretive and analytical skills. You will be physically fit with an open, manual driver’s licence, 4WD experience and have availability to undertake field swings for up to 2 weeks at a time.
Your understanding of the application of Federal and State legislation for groundwater management, regulation and compliance will be favourably viewed. With strong verbal and written communication skills, you will produce exemplary written reports. You will liaise directly with key stakeholders and enrich client relationships.
You will share AGE’s values of being accountable to clients and to each other, and these values will drive your high standards to achieve successful outcomes.
On a personal note you will enjoy glorious sunny weather and the terrific lifestyle that Queensland has to offer.
The Opportunities
AGE is one of Australia’s largest specialist groundwater consultancies with a strong focus in technical quality, integrity, and commitment to our clients. You will work alongside a team of principal consultants, many of whom have been in the industry for more than 20 years. We offer access to leading edge technology and strong expertise in numerical modelling.
After experiencing consistent growth over many years, we have a very healthy pipeline of groundwater work and this new role is an integral part of our current and future development plans. Progression to senior management will be fostered as part of AGE’s professional development pathway. A competitive salary commensurate with experience will be negotiable. This is a long-term opportunity to enrich your hydrogeology career with no glass ceilings and genuine, achievable business ownership options.
North Queensland offers a welcoming community, abundant coastal activities and uplifting warm weather, with the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park a short boat ride away. Alternatively, you might like to spend your weekends discovering the 23 bays and beaches of Magnetic Island, just 20 minutes away by ferry.
Applicants residing in other regions within Australia are encouraged to apply and relocation support is provided. For this particular role, we are only able to accept applications from professionals who are currently located in Australia.
All applications will be managed with strict confidentiality. Please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your interest in this role to our recruitment management consultant, Susan Leon via the link
We thank recruitment agencies for their interest however, AGE Consultants and Susan Leon do not wish to be contacted regarding this campaign.

Job Descriptions:
We are accepting applications for a Senior Mako Product Specialist position within our Joint Replacement team in Toowoomba, QLD.
The Role:
Be the ‘go-to’ person in complex knee or hip operations by providing technical and clinical specialist expertise to our customers
Attend surgical procedures and assist surgeons and hospital staff in the effective use of Stryker products
Provide segmentation and planning of Mako cases by using software to prepare preoperative CT data
Grasp 2D images and translate into 3D space, in reality and on the robo
Skills and requirements:
Tertiary qualifications in either scientific, medical, engineering, biological, sports science, physiotherapy, nursing, or chiropractor discipline
Minimum 18 months relevant in field experience
Technical expert across all Robotics platform applications
Proficiency across general joint replacement including revision and navigation systems
Ability to assimilate technical information and communicate complex ideas in a simple and fluent fashion.
Ability to build consistently strong and trusting relationships with internal colleagues and customers
Ability to adapt to change in a fast-moving environment
Excellent problem-solving skills
High level presentation and communication skills
Excellent spatial skills capability
Culture and Benefits:
At Stryker, you can expect an attractive package including a broad range of discounts and benefits from a range of partners! This is a genuine opportunity for an ambitious and customer focused individual to progress and grow your career with a leading global medical device company that offers countless development opportunities.
Some of our benefits include:
Join one of Australia’s Best Places to Work in 2020!
Multiple financial benefits including health care, financial wellbeing, insurance benefits.
Ongoing training and opportunities for career progression
Paid Parental leave schemes
Volunteer Days
Onsite gym!
Being part of one of the world’s largest and most recognizable brands.
Excellent team culture – we have fun whilst we work!
A Leader who will support & guide you throughout your career
Access to employee benefits
Access to our career and self-development program from day one
Work with likeminded individuals who are driven by exceeding targets and improving patient outcomes!
Stryker is in the medical industry and the safety of our employees and communities is very important. To that end, it is a requirement that our employees be vaccinated, and it’s an inherent requirement for the successful candidate for this role to be vaccinated.

About us
One of Australia’s most successful farming operations, Mulgowie grows, packs, and distributes fresh produce for both Australian and International markets. Growing from humble beginnings, Mulgowie has complex farm and food production operations across Australia, with a mandate for continued growth and expansion across existing and new markets and product lines. We are passionate about cultivating Healthy Soil, growing Healthy Plants, and producing nutritious products for Healthy People.
About the role
Reporting to the Company Quality Manager, you will be responsible to ensure regional compliance to Food Safety and Quality standards and build site capability to deliver and exceed quality performance expectations.
Responsibilities
Ensuring compliance to our Quality Management System processes and customer specifications
Monitoring processes to ensure compliance and early escalation of non-conformances
Review of production and quality monitoring records and verification activities to ensure control of processes
Trend analysis of production data and correction of non-conforming trends
Coordination of internal and external calibration activities
Coordination of External Audit activities
Effective investigation of Corrective Action Requests and Customer Complaint Investigations
Continuous Improvement of Quality System processes through cross-functional engagement
Coach and train staff to ensure compliance with Company and customer standards
Promoting Mulgowie Values
Profile
Formal Quality training ie Science, Food Science or Quality Management
Strong back in team management ledership
Experience in Quality Systems e.g., Freshcare, SQF or ISO Management Systems
Skills and abilities:
Support a Team Approach to problem Solving
Team player with excellent organisation skills and with the ability to prioritise and meet deadlines
High levels of initiative and the ability to apply discretion, confidentiality and judgement
Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
Flexible on working hours – able to make an early morning shift, late evening or a weekend
Experience working in a Fast-paced environment"
Why Join Us?
At Mulgowie, we value the Consumer in all of our decision making; value the safety of our people and product; respect all people and are united through team spirit; and value clear communication whilst welcoming all ideas for improvement.
This is an exciting role for candidates who pride themselves on providing a high level of customer satisfaction and have the drive to continue professional growth to support and strengthen our high calibre operations.
Salary will be negotiated with the successful applicant and will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.
If you believe that you are a fit for this role, please apply by clicking on “Apply Now” attaching your current resume

Project Overview:
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.
ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

**Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia

Position Summary:
Based working out of Jabiru (working a 2 week on 1 week off roster), under minimal supervision, our project Occupational Hygienist will be responsible for implementing and administering project industrial hygiene programs affecting employee, public safety and occupational health.

You are a key asset to the project line management - administering a proactive prevention program for occupational accidents and illnesses.

This role will require you to perform moderately complex technical work in a wide range of industrial hygiene disciplines to achieve compliance with ES&H standards along with federal and state regulatory requirements.
This is your chance to use your knowledge and experience to develop, implement and maintain industrial hygiene programs, systems and procedures; as well as monitor and prevent hazards and diseases that may be found in the work area.

Investigating accidents, injuries, and complaints concerning hazards in the workplace and recommending improvements in processes, design, procedures and operating equipment to minimize hazards will also form part of your role.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
Complete risk assessments of potential occupational health hazards
Develop and maintain an occupational hygiene profile for the project
Establish and maintain the occupational hygiene record system for the project
Establish necessary interfaces, resources and tools for occupational hygiene activities
Develop, implement and provide oversight for the occupational hygiene program
Develop and conduct employee training
Coordinate with leaders on risk controls associated with occupational health risks
Promote compliance with programs, regulations, permits, approvals and requirements
Provide occupational hygiene training
Communicate information about occupational health hazards
Determine the OELs for the workplace
provides regulatory interpretation and technical advice
Seek technical guidance when OELs are unavailable
Apply the OELs to occupational health hazards
Conduct occupational exposure assessments to the defined schedule
Maintain instruments and other equipment required for sampling and assessment
Review contractor OHRA for work scopes and provide technical recommendation for managing work safely
Train and assist junior ESH personnel in sampling and collection methodologies.
Conduct and assist the project with sampling, monitoring, data interpretation and occupational health surveys to ensure compliance with established programs.
Provide regulatory interpretation and technical advice; may provide guidance for a team of ES&H specialists and/or support personnel.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
BS/MS in Occupational Safety, Occupational Health, Industrial Hygiene, or related science or engineering field and solid experience in a construction environment. In lieu of a degree, extensive relevant experience in a construction environment.
AIOH Certification Required.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.

Shaping tomorrow together
Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.

At PSC we're helping power a more sustainable world. Our global team of electricity experts have been tackling the thorniest problems for some of the most prominent industry players for over 25 years. By empowering people to make a difference and do the right thing, we help our clients and employees innovate and thrive in a rapidly changing industry.

As a SCADA/EMS Engineer, you will work with our clients on projects and day to day tasks required to update and maintain complex real-time Energy Management Systems. You will develop approaches for maintaining the system operation, patching systems, upgrading applications and versions of the client real-time platforms. You will work in a team of professionals at the client site to ensure all systems are functional and new deployments meet the clients’ functional requirements.

Available locations: Darwin, Perth or Brisbane

Key Accountabilities

Various real-time system configurations, modelling and testing
Documenting configuration and testing as appropriate
Understanding the system architecture as to provide appropriate input on performance and maintenance needs
Ensuring client needs are met and options to improve are presented

Minimum Expertise

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science/Power Systems Engineering or related field or equivalent practical experience with certifiable competencies in the SCADA and EMS field
Project delivery and/or consulting experience in the electricity sector
Minimum of five (5) years of EMS/SCADA experience
Hands–on experience with an EMS vendor system (GE e-Terra, Siemens, ABB, Schneider, OSI Monarch)
Experience with SQL based RDBMS databases
Coding experience in languages such as C++, Python, PERL etc
Excellent computer system skills, including Windows server, Windows desktops, and Linux
Proficiency with EMS modelling tools (SCADA, Network, Generation) and display building tools
Proficiency with server hardware, virtualization, and networking

Preferred Expertise

Experience with EMS domains (SCADA, Generation, Network, Dispatcher Training Simulator) and applications (Historians, Alarms, Mapboard, Load Shed, Outage Scheduler, Variable Line Rating, OAG, RTNET, VAST, PSSE and historian)
Experience with Factory or Site Acceptance Testing
Experience integrating complex software systems
Operator Experience
Expertise with Distributed Energy Resources / DERMS
Performing or creating training programs

Specific Requirements

Proven experience in problem analysis, design, implementation, testing and documentation for energy management systems
Utility operational technology project and support experience and mindset
Basic understanding of the day-to-day operations of a power utility control room
Working knowledge of maintaining IT infrastructure that supports real-time critical business systems
An understanding that IT/OT infrastructure only exists to serve a functional purpose for end-users
Strong ability to communicate (verbal and written) technical and complex information
Ability to travel within Australia


Opportunity Benefits

Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity to join an established and growing global organization
Join a highly collaborative worldwide team of professionals
Be a part of a team that drives the industry forward
Join a team that values people, giving them the opportunity to develop their career direction

Requisition ID: 264411
Relocation Authorized: National - Camp
Telework Type: Full-Time Office/Project
Work Location: Brisbane, QLD

Project Overview:
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.
ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

**Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia

Position Summary:
Based working out of Jabiru (working a 2 week on 1 week off roster), under minimal supervision, our project Occupational Hygienist will be responsible for implementing and administering project industrial hygiene programs affecting employee, public safety and occupational health.

You are a key asset to the project line management - administering a proactive prevention program for occupational accidents and illnesses.

This role will require you to perform moderately complex technical work in a wide range of industrial hygiene disciplines to achieve compliance with ES&H standards along with federal and state regulatory requirements.
This is your chance to use your knowledge and experience to develop, implement and maintain industrial hygiene programs, systems and procedures; as well as monitor and prevent hazards and diseases that may be found in the work area.

Investigating accidents, injuries, and complaints concerning hazards in the workplace and recommending improvements in processes, design, procedures and operating equipment to minimize hazards will also form part of your role.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
Complete risk assessments of potential occupational health hazards
Develop and maintain an occupational hygiene profile for the project
Establish and maintain the occupational hygiene record system for the project
Establish necessary interfaces, resources and tools for occupational hygiene activities
Develop, implement and provide oversight for the occupational hygiene program
Develop and conduct employee training
Coordinate with leaders on risk controls associated with occupational health risks
Promote compliance with programs, regulations, permits, approvals and requirements
Provide occupational hygiene training
Communicate information about occupational health hazards
Determine the OELs for the workplace
provides regulatory interpretation and technical advice
Seek technical guidance when OELs are unavailable
Apply the OELs to occupational health hazards
Conduct occupational exposure assessments to the defined schedule
Maintain instruments and other equipment required for sampling and assessment
Review contractor OHRA for work scopes and provide technical recommendation for managing work safely
Train and assist junior ESH personnel in sampling and collection methodologies.
Conduct and assist the project with sampling, monitoring, data interpretation and occupational health surveys to ensure compliance with established programs.
Provide regulatory interpretation and technical advice; may provide guidance for a team of ES&H specialists and/or support personnel.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
BS/MS in Occupational Safety, Occupational Health, Industrial Hygiene, or related science or engineering field and solid experience in a construction environment. In lieu of a degree, extensive relevant experience in a construction environment.
AIOH Certification Required.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.

Shaping tomorrow together
Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.

Work from home 2-3 days per week.
Data centric organisation with heavy investment in Technology
About Our Client
This organisation is a national leader in the field of pharmaceutical wholesale and distribution. They are investing heavily in improving their operational performance and compliance targets, and the Data & Analytics stream is central to this.
Job Description
Working cross-functionally with data engineering, analytics, and business stakeholders, the Data Engineering Technical Lead will oversee the implementation of data architecture, and lead the modelling, design, development, and implementation of data engineering solutions running on a cloud environment.

Key accountabilities will include:

Ensuring the organisation's Data Engineering platform and products aligns to global best practice in terms of engineering and operations.


Oversee the implementation of data architecture, and lead the modelling, design, development, and implementation of data engineering solutions running on the cloud environment.


Utilising your extensive experience in data warehousing, data engineering, data modelling, and data integration to drive the Data & Analytics function.
Directly be involved in hiring of Data Engineers in the team as they continue to grow.


Please note that while this is a leadership role, this is NOT a people management position. The Technical Lead, alongside the rest of the Data Engineering and Analytics team, will report to the Manager of Data Engineering.
The Successful Applicant
Key skills required include:
Very strong Data modelling skills (including Dimensional and Relational modelling), as well as Data warehouse and Power BI development.
4-5 years Technical Leadership experience of a Data Engineering team, remaining hands on throughout.
Strong in Azure DataFactory (ADF), Power BI, Power Automate, and Snowflake.
Azure DevOps (including developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines) and Github.
Experience with the implementation of Data Governance frameworks, and a good understanding of Data Architectures.
Agile (Scrum Master certification would be a bonus)
Solid stakeholder management experience (both technical and non-technical)
Strong understanding of DataOps and Automation

Nice to have (not essential):
Data Science skills
Python / R / Scala or similar
Bash or Powershell scripting
Healthcare or Logistics (Distribution) industry exposure
What's on Offer
Hybrid work model - working from home 50% of the time.
Highly competitive salary package (up to $180k base plus super) plus a generous annual bonus.
Melbourne office HQ - while the majority of your time in office will be based in Brisbane, occasional travel to the brand new national head office in Melbourne will be required.
People focussed, supportive business that invests in your ongoing learning and development path.
Opportunity to progress into a people management role in future is available for those who are seeking this in their career future.
Excellent work-life balance and employee benefits, including access to leading health & wellbeing programs.

Position Summary
As our Project ESH (Environment Safety and Health) Coordinator and Onboarding Advisor you will be responsible for providing ESH advice and facilitating, promoting and coordinating activities related to ensuring the health and safety of all project participants is maintained for the duration of the ERA Ranger Rehabilitation Project.

You will champion the onboarding of contractors to the Project ESH site requirements and ensure contractors audits and reviews are scheduled accordingly. Within this role you will continuously contribute to a positive safety culture - leading by example, coaching personnel and providing timely advice and support as required to the contractor and the project ESH Team.

This role will be based on site at the Ranger Mine jobsite offices where you will be assigned on a fly in/fly out roster (2 weeks on, 1 week off) flying to and from Darwin - with a drive to the Jabiru work site - where camp accommodation is provided.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to)
Work with Contracts team to ensure contractors are project ready
Establish the contractor onboarding schedule
Ensure contractor completes all prerequisites in relation to site mobilisation
Support handover to ESH site-based team
Provide technical support for site ESH assessments and project risk assessments including - Level 2 Risk Assessments, Job Hazards Analysis (JHA), review scopes of work for site ESH requirements
Contribute to readiness with timely notifications and actively participating in project 30/60/90-day planning
Contribute & coach improvement of HSE processes and procedures
Support theimplementation of the Contractor HSE plan and ensure alignment in accordance with established polices, systems, processes, procedures and methods and regulations.
Participate in meetings with customers, project team members, and contractors/subcontractors to advise of project-specific mitigation plan, training program, and technical reports
Assist in data collection and interpretation onproject accident investigations; documents factors contributing to an incident and prepares required reports
Supportinspection tours, audits of the project/facility for compliance with project ES&H requirements
Develop cross-training for personnel in professional or discipline-specific skills, techniques, and procedures
Support timely intervention of medical/first aid treatment and ensure contractors have effective stay at work programs for injured workers including alternate work duties.
Contribute to the project ESH orientation and training of project manual/non-manual personnel
Ensure contractor compliance in theimplementation of environmental compliance inspections conducted to monitor compliance with environmental requirements including daily inspections and waste forecast and waste disposal
Interpret applicable HSE standards and supervises implementation into work design and delivery
Complete timely report of contractor HSE performance as per project reporting requirements
Execute other HSE duties as assigned by supervisor, Site Manager, Project HSE Manager, or designated GBU ES&H management.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
Formal qualifications in environmental and/or safety engineering, process safety, health or related discipline.
Demonstrated experience in construction or mining in a safety role with some experience in supervising small teams.
Working and applied knowledge of HSE sciences/engineering systems, principles, and methodologies.
Knowledge of and experience working within an Australian legislation context (e.g. interpreting and providing advice based on relevant OHS Acts & Regulations).
Knowledge of permitting processes and responsibilities, Industry standards for HSE compliance, and best management practices for minimising HSE impacts during project execution.
Knowledge of engineering and construction systems, methods and work processes, construction planning, estimating, procedures, and execution.
Exposure to project closure or rehabilitation projects preferred.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.
